name: teaser
content:
teaser noun [C]
(FOR PRODUCT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an article, advertisement, short film, etc. that gives a small amount of information about a subject, product, etc. in order to make people interested in seeing or hearing more about it later: The company has posted another teaser for its event at the Game Developers Conference next week. They ran a 30-second teaser for the upcoming movie. The recording is already up on Spotify and there are teaser ads online.
business
  specialized a product or service that is sold at a very low price in order to encourage people to buy it or use it, with the price usually increasing later: We shall crack down on unfair teasers that downplay permanent higher interest rates and trumpet temporary lower rates. After the teaser rate expires, these loans usually adjust rates upward.

teaser noun [C]
(ANIMAL)
biology
  specialized a male animal that is used to encourage a female animal to be ready to mate (= have sex) in order to make it easier for another, especially chosen, male to actually mate with her: The stallion's stand-in is a professional teaser. His job is to test if a visiting mare is "receptive". No teaser dog is needed to excite the bitches - Otto is a natural charmer.
